extracurricular_activities: Smile at School (Ghana education crowdfunding initiative)

facilities.classrooms_labs_quality: New building opened end of 2020 - almost energy neutral, no gas, labeled as good acoustic environment

environment.culture_values: Christian scholastic community with motto: 'A place where everyone is equal, but nobody is the same.' Focus on individuality within community.

admission_info: Voorrangsregels: 1 broer, zus; 2 Amstelveen, Nes, Ouderkerk; 3 Aalsmeer, Uithoorn, Badhoevedorp; 4 overige plaatsen

strengths: Located in Amstelveen - very close to student home address
Large school (1866 students) with comprehensive program offerings
New, modern, sustainable building (2020) with excellent acoustics
Bilingual education and international orientation options
Multiple tracks from VMBO-T through Gymnasium
Strong student support systems (mentoring, career guidance, socio-emotional)
Christian values with emphasis on individuality and equality
Active community engagement (Smile at School Ghana initiative)
considerations: Christian affiliation may be important consideration for some families
Large school size may not suit students preferring smaller environments
Serves students from multiple municipalities (Amstelveen, Aalsmeer, Ouderkerk, Uithoorn, Badhoevedorp)
best_fit_for: Students living in Amstelveen seeking short commute
Families valuing Christian education with inclusive motto
Students of various academic levels (VMBO-T through Gymnasium)
Students who thrive in larger school communities
Students interested in arts, culture, and global citizenship
ai_analysis.summary: Hermann Wesselink College is a large, modern Christian school in Amstelveen offering comprehensive education from VMBO-T through Gymnasium, including bilingual options. Located very close to the student's home, it features a new energy-neutral building with excellent facilities. With its motto 'everyone is equal, but nobody is the same,' the school balances Christian values with inclusive individuality. Strong support systems and international orientation make it suitable for diverse learners.
